definitions.definition: A grinding apparatus for substances such as grains , seeds , etc.
examples: Pepper has a stronger flavor when it is ground straight from a mill .

definitions.definition: The building housing such a grinding apparatus; also, any similar building that houses a similarly material activity (such as weaving, fulling, dying, etc.); the place of business comprising such a building and its outbuildings and grounds.
examples: My great-grandfather worked in a mill . He filled the flour sacks and then carried and loaded them.

definitions.definition: A machine used for expelling the juice, sap, etc., from vegetable tissues by pressure, or by pressure in combination with a grinding, or cutting process.
examples: a cider mill ; a cane mill

definitions.definition: A machine for grinding and polishing.
examples: a lapidary mill

definitions.definition: A milling machine for machining of solid metal , wood, or plastic.
examples: Several machinists were busy operating the lathes, mills , and drill presses on the shop floor.

definitions.definition: A milling cutter used on such a machine.
examples: After the drilling and tapping operations, we come in with a mill and do some contouring.

definitions.definition: A manufacturing plant for paper, steel, textiles, flooring, and some other kinds of materials.
examples: Once the billet gets through the 56-inch mill , it is ready for reheating.

definitions.definition: The building complex housing such a plant; the place of business comprising such buildings and their grounds.
examples: My grandfather worked in a mill . He operated machinery, did maintenance, and drove forklifts.

definitions.definition: ( figurative , usually derogatory ) An establishment that handles a certain type of situation or procedure routinely, or produces large quantities of an item without much regard to quality. (The notion of churning out massive amounts indiscriminately underlies the figurative metaphor.)
examples: Those shysters selling the purebreds are running quite a mill over there, eh?

definitions.definition: ( figurative , derogatory ) An institution or pseudo-institutional business awarding credentials (such as diplomas , degrees , certificates , or certifications ) of either dubious value or fraudulent nature; one selling essays or other documents for the buyers (usually students) to fraudulently pass off as their own.
examples: Those shysters cranking out the "IT training certificates" are running quite a mill over there, eh?

definitions.definition: ( informal ) An engine .
examples: Under the hood is a mill that you and I can't afford — a nitrous-blown hemi with custom heads.

definitions.definition: ( informal , archaic ) A boxing match or fistfight .
examples: They were betting big on a great mill , but they didn't realize that the fix was in.

definitions.definition: ( die sinking ) A hardened steel roller with a design in relief, used for imprinting a reversed copy of the design in a softer metal, such as copper.
( mining ) An excavation in rock, transverse to the workings, from which material for filling is obtained.
examples: They pulled me off the main crew and had me digging in the mill .

definitions.definition: ( mining ) A passage underground through which ore is shot.
examples: The geologists were responsible for keeping the work within the mill .

definitions.definition: The raised or ridged edge or surface made in milling anything, such as a coin or screw.
( historical ) A prison treadmill .
examples: They kept us in line by threatening to put us on the mill twice as long if we complained.

definitions.definition: ( US military slang , World War I , World War II ) A military prison , either guardhouse or post prison .
examples: He spent some time in the mill after that escapade.

definitions.definition: ( military slang , World War I , World War II ) A delousing station: a cootie mill.
( CB radio slang ) A typewriter used to transcribe messages received.

definitions.definition: One thousandth part.

subdefinitions.definition: One thousandth of a US dollar , or one tenth of a cent .
examples: The U.S. has never minted a mill coin, but the Coinage Act of 1792 describes this and other subdivisions of the U.S. dollar.

subdefinitions.definition: One thousandth part in millage rates of property tax .
examples: They predict that the rate will probably go up by several mills next year.

subdefinitions.definition: ( engineering , manufacturing ) Alternative form of mil ( “ one thousandth of an inch ” ) .
examples: For this task, I prefer the plastic sheeting that is 10 mills thick.
For this task, I prefer the plastic bars that are 10 mills in diameter.

definitions.definition: ( informal ) Alternative form of mil ( “ million ” ) .

main_definition: ( informal ) Alternative form of mil ( “ million ” ) .

definitions.definition: A line of three matching pieces in nine men's morris and related games.

main_definition: A line of three matching pieces in nine men's morris and related games.

definitions.definition: Discarding a card from one's deck.
A strategy centered on depleting the opponent's deck.

main_definition: ( collectible card games ) Discarding a card from one's deck.
secondary_definitions: ( collectible card games ) A strategy centered on depleting the opponent's deck.
